Excerpts from "Mai Ma" ("Selling Horses"); a standard piece of Beijing Opera; content comes from the romance "Sui-Tang Yan Yi" in the Qing Dynasty; plot is about general Qin Qiong in Tang Dynasty; sung in erhuang style; unidentified accompaniment. 《卖马》；京剧；取材于《隋唐演义》及《说唐》；老生行；二黄唱腔. Excerpts from "Shuang Bao An" ("The Real and Fake Justice Bao")

Excerpts from "Shuang Bao An" ("The Real and Fake Justice Bao"); Beijing Opera; from the story of Bao Zheng (Justice Bao) in the Song Dynasty; accompanied by pipa where a liushui tempo is used as bridge. 《双包案》；京剧；真假包公的故事；琵琶伴奏，中间有一段流水板. [Unidentified performers]. ca. 1901 - 1902, China, Shanghai, [Unidentified location]. (03:14)

"Shi Bi Shi Xiang" (Ten Metaphors, Ten Thoughts)

"Shi Bi Shi Xiang" (Ten Metaphors, Ten Thoughts); performed in the style of gushu, which popular in Beijing, Hebei, and Tianjin. This piece tells about the mood of a prostitute missing his true lover, who is talented and knowledgeable. "Shi Bi Shi Xiang" (Ten Metaphors, Ten Thoughts) is follow by "Shi Yuan Shi Hen", which is also included in this collection. See SCY 3015-3017 for another version of this song.
